designations.source: A review of the beetles of Great Britain: Ground Beetles (Carabidae)
designations.source_description: This report was commissioned to update the national status of ground beetles using IUCN methodology for assessing threat. It covers all species of Carabidae in Great Britain, identifying those that are rare and/or under threat as well as non-threatened and non-native species.
designations.reporting_category: Red listing based on 2001 IUCN guidelines
designations.designation_description: Taxa which do not qualify for Lower Risk (conservation dependent), but which are close to qualifying for Vulnerable. In Britain, this category includes species which occur in 15 or fewer hectads but do not qualify as Critically Endangered, Endangered or Vulnerable.
designations.comments: This species is almost entirely confined to the  New Forest, with records from two adjacent hectads; the only exception being a record from Cranborne, Dorset (SU01) in 1937. The species has been stable in its geographical range in the New Forest since at least the early 1900s. There appear to be no plausible threats to the microhabitat, habitat or landscape occupied by E. walkerianus other than the pervasive threats such as climatic change and air pollution.
